Requirements: - Only can be called by the {pendingDefaultAdmin}'s `newAdmin`. - The {pendingDefaultAdmin}'s `acceptSchedule` should've passed."},"beginDefaultAdminTransfer(address)":{"details":"Starts a {defaultAdmin} transfer by setting a {pendingDefaultAdmin} scheduled for acceptance after the current timestamp plus a {defaultAdminDelay}. May emit a DefaultAdminTransferCanceled event."},"changeDefaultAdminDelay(uint48)":{"details":"Initiates a {defaultAdminDelay} update by setting a {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} scheduled for getting into effect after the current timestamp plus a {defaultAdminDelay}. This function guarantees that any call to {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} done between the timestamp this method is called and the {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} effect schedule will use the current {defaultAdminDelay} set before calling. The {pendingDefaultAdminDelay}'s effect schedule is defined in a way that waiting until the schedule and then calling {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} with the new delay will take at least the same as another {defaultAdmin} complete transfer (including acceptance). The schedule is designed for two scenarios: - When the delay is changed for a larger one the schedule is `block.timestamp + newDelay` capped by {defaultAdminDelayIncreaseWait}. - When the delay is changed for a shorter one, the schedule is `block.timestamp + (current delay - new delay)`. A {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} that never got into effect will be canceled in favor of a new scheduled change. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. Emits a DefaultAdminDelayChangeScheduled event and may emit a DefaultAdminDelayChangeCanceled event."},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"defaultAdmin()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` holder."},"defaultAdminDelay()":{"details":"Returns the delay required to schedule the acceptance of a {defaultAdmin} transfer started. This delay will be added to the current timestamp when calling {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} to set the acceptance schedule. NOTE: If a delay change has been scheduled, it will take effect as soon as the schedule passes, making this function returns the new delay. See {changeDefaultAdminDelay}."},"defaultAdminDelayIncreaseWait()":{"details":"Maximum time in seconds for an increase to {defaultAdminDelay} (that is scheduled using {changeDefaultAdminDelay}) to take effect. Default to 5 days. When the {defaultAdminDelay} is scheduled to be increased, it goes into effect after the new delay has passed with the purpose of giving enough time for reverting any accidental change (i.e. using milliseconds instead of seconds) that may lock the contract. However, to avoid excessive schedules, the wait is capped by this function and it can be overrode for a custom {defaultAdminDelay} increase scheduling. IMPORTANT: Make sure to add a reasonable amount of time while overriding this value, otherwise, there's a risk of setting a high new delay that goes into effect almost immediately without the possibility of human intervention in the case of an input error (eg. set milliseconds instead of seconds)."},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n// OpenZeppelin Contracts v4.4.1 (token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol)\n\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nimport \"../IERC20.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @dev Interface for the (uint8);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x8de418a5503946cabe331f35fe242d3201a73f67f77aaeb7110acb1f30423aca","license":"MIT"},"contracts/Bondage.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.9;\n\nimport \"./libraries/templates/ContractBase.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/security/ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/CountersUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/structs/EnumerableSetUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/structs/EnumerableMapUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC20Metadata.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/interfaces/IERC20.sol\";\nimport \"./Treasury.sol\";\n\n\n/// @custom:security-contact security@hydranet.ai\ncontract Bondage is ContractUpgradableDelegatable, ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable {\n    // CONFIG\n    using CountersUpgradeable for CountersUpgradeable.Counter;\n    using EnumerableSetUpgradeable for EnumerableSetUpgradeable.UintSet;\n    using EnumerableSetUpgradeable for EnumerableSetUpgradeable.AddressSet;\n\n    // STATE\n    IERC20Metadata private _token;\n    Treasury private _treasury;\n    BondMap private _maturingBonds;\n    BondMarketMap private _bondMarkets;\n    uint256 private _startTimestamp;\n\n    // EVENTS\n    event BondMarketCreated(BondMarket market);\n    event BondMarketDeleted(BondMarket market);\n    event BondMarketOpened(BondMarket market);\n    event BondMarketClosed(BondMarket market);\n    event BondSold(address indexed owner, Bond bond);\n    event BondClaimed(address indexed owner, Bond bond);\n\n    // ERRORS\n    error BondIndexCorrupted();\n    error BondSaleActive();\n    error BondSaleNotActive();\n    error BondMarketNotActive(uint id);\n    error BondMarketInsufficientVolume(uint id, uint amount, uint volume);\n    error BondMarketFundingTransferFailed(uint volume);\n    error BondMarketClosingInsufficientBalance(uint amount, uint balance);\n    error BondMarketClosingRefundTransferFailed(uint amount);\n    error BondNotActive(uint id);\n    error BondNotMatured(uint id);\n    error BondNotOwnedByCaller(uint id);\n    error BondPayoutTransferFailed(uint id);\n    error BondBuyTransferFailed(uint market, uint amount, uint quoteAmount);\n\n    // TYPES\n\n    struct BondMarket {\n        uint id; // Sequential, generated on creation\n        address quoteToken; // ERC-20 Contract representing token used to buy bond\n        uint price; // For 1 Token in num. quoteTokens (respecting digits from quoteToken ERC-20)\n        uint duration; // Time in seconds from buying bond until maturation\n        uint volume; // Total num. of our Tokens (HDN) to be sold in this market (market = \"round of bonds\")\n        uint sold; // Num. of our Tokens (HDN) sold in this market so far\n    }\n\n    struct Bond {\n        uint id; // Sequential, generated on buy\n        uint marketId; // BondMarket.id\n        address owner; // Owner of this bond\n        uint maturation; // Timestamp when bond is matured and can be claimed\n        uint amount; // Num. of our Tokens (HDN) locked in this bond\n        uint price; // For 1 Token (1 HDN = 1 * 10 ** HDN.decimals()) in num. quoteTokens\n        address quoteToken; // ERC-20 Contract representing token used to buy bond\n        uint term; // Duration of bond in seconds (from corresponding BondMarket)\n    }\n\n    // Also called a BondSale or \"round of bonds\"\n    struct BondMarketMap {\n        CountersUpgradeable.Counter seqId;\n        EnumerableSetUpgradeable.UintSet ids;\n        mapping(uint => BondMarket) markets;\n        uint256 live; // Is the BondSale active (1), in preparation (0), or suspended (3)?\n    }\n\n    struct BondMap {\n        CountersUpgradeable.Counter seqId; // Sequential ID generator\n        EnumerableSetUpgradeable.AddressSet addresses;\n        mapping(address => uint[]) index;\n        mapping(uint => Bond) bonds;\n    }\n\n    ////// INITIALIZATION //////\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    function initialize(\n        address admin,\n        address token,\n        address treasury\n    ) public initializer {\n        __BaseContract_init(admin);\n\n        _token = IERC20Metadata(token);\n        _treasury = Treasury(treasury);\n    }\n\n    ////// PUBLIC //////\n\n    // USER / EVERONE //\n\n    function buyBond(uint marketId, uint amount) public nonReentrant {\n        if (!_bondMarkets.ids.contains(marketId)) {\n            revert BondMarketNotActive(marketId);\n        }\n        BondMarket memory market = _bondMarkets.markets[marketId];\n        if (market.volume - market.sold < amount) {\n            revert BondMarketInsufficientVolume(\n                marketId,\n                amount,\n                market.volume\n            );\n        }\n\n        // Pay for bond\n        IERC20 quoteToken = IERC20(market.quoteToken);\n        uint quoteAmount = (amount * market.price) / 10 ** _token.decimals();\n        // TODO: Permit2 (Allowance Management)\n        bool success = quoteToken.transferFrom(\n            _msgSender(),\n            address(_treasury),\n            quoteAmount\n        );\n        if (!success) {\n            revert BondBuyTransferFailed(marketId, amount, quoteAmount);\n        }\n\n        // Store maturing bond\n        _maturingBonds.seqId.increment();\n        Bond memory bond = Bond(\n            _maturingBonds.seqId.current(),\n            marketId,\n            _msgSender(),\n            block.timestamp + market.duration,\n            amount,\n            market.price,\n            market.quoteToken,\n            market.duration\n        );\n        _maturingBonds.bonds[bond.id] = bond;\n        _maturingBonds.index[bond.owner].push(bond.id);\n        _maturingBonds.addresses.add(bond.owner);\n\n        // Update market\n        market.sold += amount;\n        _bondMarkets.markets[marketId].sold = market.sold;\n        if (market.volume == market.sold) {\n            _closeBondMarket(marketId);\n        }\n\n        emit BondSold(_msgSender(), bond);\n    }\n\n    function claimBond(uint bondId) public nonReentrant {\n        _claimBond(bondId);\n    }\n\n    function claimBonds(uint[] calldata bondIds) public nonReentrant {\n        for (uint i = 0; i < bondIds.length; i++) {\n            _claimBond(bondIds[i]);\n        }\n    }\n\n    // BONDS MANAGER //\n\n    function bondMarketClose(uint id) public onlyRole(OPERATOR_ROLE) {\n        if (_bondMarkets.live != 1) {\n            revert BondSaleNotActive();\n        }\n        _closeBondMarket(id);\n    }\n\n    function bondSaleNew() public onlyRole(OPERATOR_ROLE) {\n        if (_bondMarkets.live == 1) {\n            revert BondSaleActive();\n        }\n\n        if (_bondMarkets.ids.length() > 0) {\n            for (uint i = 0; i < _bondMarkets.ids.length(); i++) {\n                uint id = _bondMarkets.ids.at(i);\n                emit BondMarketDeleted(_bondMarkets.markets[id]);\n                delete _bondMarkets.markets[id];\n                _bondMarkets.ids.remove(id);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function bondSaleAdd(\n        address quoteToken,\n        uint price,\n        uint duration,\n        uint volume\n    ) public onlyRole(OPERATOR_ROLE) {\n        if (_bondMarkets.live == 1) {\n            revert BondSaleActive();\n        }\n        _createBondMarket(quoteToken, price, duration, volume);\n    }\n\n    function bondSaleStart() public onlyRole(OPERATOR_ROLE) {\n        if (_bondMarkets.live == 1) {\n            revert BondSaleActive();\n        }\n        for (uint i = 0; i < _bondMarkets.ids.length(); i++) {\n            uint id = _bondMarkets.ids.at(i);\n            emit BondMarketOpened(_bondMarkets.markets[id]);\n        }\n        _bondMarkets.live = 1;\n        _startTimestamp = block.timestamp;\n    }\n\n    function bondSaleClose() public onlyRole(OPERATOR_ROLE) {\n        if (_bondMarkets.live != 1) {\n            revert BondSaleNotActive();\n        }\n        uint[] memory activeMarketsIx = _bondMarkets.ids.values();\n        for (uint i = 0; i < activeMarketsIx.length; i++) {\n            _closeBondMarket(activeMarketsIx[i]);\n        }\n        _bondMarkets.live = 0;\n        _startTimestamp = 0;\n    }\n\n    // BONDS MANAGER VIEWS //\n\n    function bondSaleViewStaging() public view returns (BondMarket[] memory) {\n        if (_bondMarkets.live == 1) {\n            revert BondSaleActive();\n        }\n\n        return _viewActiveMarkets();\n    }\n\n    //// PUBLIC VIEW FUNCTIONS ////\n\n    function activeMarkets() public view returns (BondMarket[] memory) {\n        if (_bondMarkets.live != 1) {\n            return new BondMarket[](0);\n        }\n\n        return _viewActiveMarkets();\n    }\n\n    function maturingBonds(address owner) public view returns (Bond[] memory) {\n        Bond[] memory bonds = new Bond[](_maturingBonds.index[owner].length);\n        for (uint i = 0; i < _maturingBonds.index[owner].length; i++) {\n            bonds[i] = _maturingBonds.bonds[_maturingBonds.index[owner][i]];\n        }\n        return bonds;\n    }\n\n    function allMaturingBonds() public view returns (Bond[] memory) {\n        // Determine num. of bonds\n        uint length = 0;\n        for (uint i = 0; i < _maturingBonds.addresses.length(); i++) {\n            address owner = _maturingBonds.addresses.at(i);\n            length += _maturingBonds.index[owner].length;\n        }\n        Bond[] memory bonds = new Bond[](length);\n        uint ix = 0;\n        for (uint i = 0; i < _maturingBonds.addresses.length(); i++) {\n            address owner = _maturingBonds.addresses.at(i);\n            for (uint j = 0; j < _maturingBonds.index[owner].length; j++) {\n                bonds[ix] = _maturingBonds.bonds[\n                    _maturingBonds.index[owner][j]\n                ];\n                ix++;\n            }\n        }\n        return bonds;\n    }\n\n    function claimableBonds() public view returns (Bond[] memory) {\n        Bond[] memory bonds = allMaturingBonds();\n        uint length = 0;\n        for (uint i = 0; i < bonds.length; i++) {\n            if (bonds[i].maturation < block.timestamp) {\n                length++;\n            }\n        }\n        Bond[] memory overdueBonds = new Bond[](length);\n        uint ix = 0;\n        for (uint i = 0; i < bonds.length; i++) {\n            if (bonds[i].maturation < block.timestamp) {\n                overdueBonds[ix] = bonds[i];\n                ix++;\n            }\n        }\n        return overdueBonds;\n    }\n\n    function bondSaleStartDate() public view returns (uint256) {\n        return _startTimestamp;\n    }\n\n\n    ////// INTERNAL //////\n\n    // DOMAIN LOGIC //\n\n    function _createBondMarket(\n        address quoteToken,\n        uint price,\n        uint duration,\n        uint volume\n    ) internal {\n        _bondMarkets.seqId.increment();\n        BondMarket memory market = BondMarket(\n            _bondMarkets.seqId.current(),\n            quoteToken,\n            price,\n            duration,\n            volume,\n            0\n        );\n        _bondMarkets.markets[market.id] = market;\n        _bondMarkets.ids.add(market.id);\n\n        _treasury.withdraw(_treasury.OP_BONDS(), address(_token), volume);\n        emit BondMarketCreated(market);\n    }\n\n    function _closeBondMarket(uint id) private {\n        if (!_bondMarkets.ids.contains(id)) {\n            revert BondMarketNotActive(id);\n        }\n        BondMarket memory market = _bondMarkets.markets[id];\n        _bondMarkets.ids.remove(id);\n        delete _bondMarkets.markets[id];\n\n        // Refund remaining volume\n        uint amount = market.volume - market.sold;\n        if (amount > 0) {\n            IERC20 token = IERC20(_token);\n            uint balance = token.balanceOf(address(this));\n            if (amount > balance) {\n                revert BondMarketClosingInsufficientBalance(amount, balance);\n            }\n            bool success = token.transfer(address(_treasury), amount);\n            if (!success) {\n                revert BondMarketClosingRefundTransferFailed(amount);\n            }\n        }\n\n        emit BondMarketClosed(market);\n    }\n\n    function _claimBond(uint id) private {\n        Bond memory bond = _maturingBonds.bonds[id];\n        if (bond.id == 0) {\n            revert BondNotActive(id);\n        }\n        if (\n            bond.owner != _msgSender() && !hasRole(MANAGER_ROLE, _msgSender())\n        ) {\n            revert BondNotOwnedByCaller(id);\n        }\n        if (bond.maturation > block.timestamp) {\n            revert BondNotMatured(id);\n        }\n\n        // Remove Bond ID from index\n        if (_maturingBonds.index[bond.owner].length == 0) {\n            revert BondIndexCorrupted();\n        } else if (_maturingBonds.index[bond.owner].length == 1) {\n            delete _maturingBonds.index[bond.owner];\n            _maturingBonds.addresses.remove(bond.owner);\n        } else {\n            uint length = _maturingBonds.index[bond.owner].length;\n            for (uint i = 0; i < length; i++) {\n                if (_maturingBonds.index[bond.owner][i] == id) {\n                    _maturingBonds.index[bond.owner][i] = _maturingBonds.index[\n                        bond.owner\n                    ][length - 1];\n                    _maturingBonds.index[bond.owner].pop();\n                    break;\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Delete Bond from active set\n        delete _maturingBonds.bonds[id];\n\n        // Payout Bond\n        bool success = IERC20(_token).transfer(bond.owner, bond.amount);\n        if (!success) {\n            revert BondPayoutTransferFailed(id);\n        }\n        emit BondClaimed(bond.owner, bond);\n    }\n\n    ////// INTERNAL VIEWS //////\n\n    function _viewActiveMarkets() internal view returns (BondMarket[] memory) {\n        BondMarket[] memory markets = new BondMarket[](\n            _bondMarkets.ids.length()\n        );\n        for (uint i = 0; i < _bondMarkets.ids.length(); i++) {\n            markets[i] = _bondMarkets.markets[_bondMarkets.ids.at(i)];\n        }\n        return markets;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xddd493493d2ce4051b845a984ec15976545362d47fb479f721b74ae643ac7c36","license":"MIT"},"contracts/Treasury.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.9;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/structs/EnumerableMapUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"./libraries/templates/ContractBase.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/IERC20.sol\";\n\n/// @custom:security-contact security@hydranet.ai\ncontract Treasury is ContractUpgradableDelegatable {\n    using EnumerableMapUpgradeable for EnumerableMapUpgradeable.UintToUintMap;\n\n    // OPERATIONS\n    bytes32 public constant OP_NULL = 0x00;\n    bytes32 public constant OP_ADMIN = keccak256(\"ADMIN_OPERATION\");\n    bytes32 public constant OP_BONDS = keccak256(\"BONDS_OPERATION\");\n\n    // STATE\n    EnumerableMapUpgradeable.UintToUintMap internal _allowances;\n    Index internal _index;\n\n    // EVENTS\n    event AllowanceApproved(\n        address approver,\n        bytes32 operation,\n        address token,\n        address spender,\n        uint256 amount\n    );\n    event AllowanceRevoked(\n        address revoker,\n        bytes32 operation,\n        address token,\n        address spender\n    );\n    event Withdrawal(\n        address recipient,\n        bytes32 operation,\n        address token,\n        uint256 amount\n    );\n\n    // ERRORS\n    error InsufficientAllowance(\n        bytes32 operation,\n        address token,\n        address spender,\n        uint256 allowance,\n        uint256 amount\n    );\n    error InsufficientBalance(address token, uint256 balance, uint256 amount);\n\n    // TYPES\n    struct Allowance {\n        bytes32 operation;\n        address token;\n        address spender;\n        uint256 amount;\n    }\n    struct Index {\n        mapping(bytes32 => mapping(address => mapping(address => uint256))) ix;\n        mapping(uint256 => bytes32) operation;\n        mapping(uint256 => address) token;\n        mapping(uint256 => address) spender;\n    }\n\n    ////// INITIALIZATION //////\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    function initialize(address admin) public initializer {\n        __BaseContract_init(admin);\n    }\n\n    ////// IMPLEMENTATION //////\n\n    function approve(\n        bytes32 operation,\n        address token,\n        address spender,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) public onlyRole(OPERATOR_ROLE) returns (bool) {\n        uint256 bal = IERC20(token).balanceOf(address(this));\n        if (bal < amount) {\n            revert InsufficientBalance(token, bal, amount);\n        }\n\n        uint256 ix = _index.ix[operation][token][spender];\n        if (ix == 0) {\n            ix = _allowances.length() + 1;\n            _index.ix[operation][token][spender] = ix;\n            _index.operation[ix] = operation;\n            _index.token[ix] = token;\n            _index.spender[ix] = spender;\n        }\n        _allowances.set(ix, amount);\n        emit AllowanceApproved(_msgSender(), operation, token, spender, amount);\n        return true;\n    }\n\n    function revoke(\n        bytes32 operation,\n        address token,\n        address spender\n    ) public onlyRole(OPERATOR_ROLE) returns (bool) {\n        uint256 ix = _index.ix[operation][token][spender];\n        if (ix == 0) {\n            revert InsufficientAllowance(operation, token, spender, 0, 0);\n        }\n        if (_allowances.get(ix) == 0) {\n            revert InsufficientAllowance(operation, token, spender, 0, 0);\n        }\n\n        _allowances.remove(ix);\n        delete _index.ix[operation][token][spender];\n        delete _index.operation[ix];\n        delete _index.token[ix];\n        delete _index.spender[ix];\n        emit AllowanceRevoked(_msgSender(), operation, token, spender);\n        return true;\n    }\n\n    function withdraw(bytes32 operation, address token, uint amount) public returns (bool) {\n        IERC20 _token = IERC20(token);\n        uint256 _balance = _token.balanceOf(address(this));\n        uint256 ix = _index.ix[operation][token][_msgSender()];\n\n        // Check allowance & balance\n        if (ix == 0) {\n            revert InsufficientAllowance(\n                operation,\n                token,\n                _msgSender(),\n                0,\n                amount\n            );\n        }\n        uint256 _allowance = _allowances.get(ix);\n        if (_allowance < amount) {\n            revert InsufficientAllowance(\n                operation,\n                token,\n                _msgSender(),\n                _allowance,\n                amount\n            );\n        }\n        if (_balance < amount) {\n            revert InsufficientBalance(token, _balance, amount);\n        }\n\n        // Update allowance\n        uint256 _new_allowance = _allowance - amount;\n        if (_new_allowance > 0) {\n            _allowances.set(ix, _new_allowance);\n        } else {\n            _allowances.remove(ix);\n            delete _index.ix[operation][token][_msgSender()];\n            delete _index.operation[ix];\n            delete _index.token[ix];\n            delete _index.spender[ix];\n        }\n\n        // Process withdrawal\n        _token.transfer(_msgSender(), amount);\n        emit Withdrawal(_msgSender(), operation, token, amount);\n        return true;\n    }\n\n    ////// PUBLIC VIEWS //////\n\n    function allowance(bytes32 operation, address token) public view returns (uint256) {\n        return allowance(operation, token, _msgSender());\n    }\n\n    function allowance(bytes32 operation, address token, address spender) public view returns (uint256) {\n        uint256 ix = _index.ix[operation][token][spender];\n        if (ix == 0) return 0;\n        return _allowances.get(ix);\n    }\n\n    function allowance(uint256 ix) public view returns (uint256) {\n        return _allowances.get(ix);\n    }\n\n    function allowances() public view returns (Allowance[] memory) {\n        Allowance[] memory alls = new Allowance[](_allowances.length());\n        for (uint i = 0; i < _allowances.length(); i++) {\n            (uint256 ix, uint256 val) = _allowances.at(i);\n            alls[i] = Allowance(\n                _index.operation[ix],\n                _index.token[ix],\n                _index.spender[ix],\n                val\n            );\n        }\n        return alls;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x10561ba5b876484383024b4be07380e535faaa05009c6d1d0d4bffef4dbcfb16","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IERC20.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol';\nimport '@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol';\n","keccak256":"0xa7688d9216368f2498b9266b56da0a1c9ffc3f65a27d42045c26b4aa60646f0e","license":"MIT"},"contracts/libraries/access/AccessControlElevation.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.9;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/introspection/ERC165Upgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/structs/EnumerableSetUpgradeable.sol\";\n\nimport \"../utils/Housekeeping.sol\";\nimport \"./Roles.sol\";\n\ninterface IAccessControlElevation {\n    function elevate(bytes32 role, address elevatedAddress) external;\n\n    function elevate(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address elevatedAddress,\n        uint duration\n    ) external;\n}\n\nabstract contract AccessControlElevation is\n    IHousekeeping,\n    ERC165Upgradeable,\n    AccessControlUpgradeable,\n    RoleAdmin\n{\n    using EnumerableSetUpgradeable for EnumerableSetUpgradeable.AddressSet;\n\n    // CONSTANTS\n    uint48 private constant DEFAULT_ELEVATION_DURATION = 24 * 60 * 60; // 24h\n\n    // STATE\n    uint48 private _elevationDuration;\n    EnumerableSetUpgradeable.AddressSet private _elevationKeys;\n    mapping(address => Elevation) private _elevations;\n\n    // ERRORS\n    error NotAdmin(address requestedElevator);\n\n    /// TYPES ///\n\n    struct Elevation {\n        bytes32 role;\n        address elevatedAddress;\n        address elevatedBy;\n        uint256 expires;\n    }\n\n    /// ADMIN ACTIONS ///\n\n    function setDefaultElevationDuration(uint48 duration) public onlyFullAdmin {\n        _elevationDuration = duration;\n    }\n\n    function elevate(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address elevatedAddress\n    ) public onlyFullAdmin {\n        _elevations[_msgSender()] = Elevation({\n            role: role,\n            elevatedAddress: elevatedAddress,\n            elevatedBy: _msgSender(),\n            expires: block.timestamp + defaultElevationDuration()\n        });\n    }\n\n    function elevate(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address elevatedAddress,\n        uint256 duration\n    ) public onlyFullAdmin {\n        _elevations[_msgSender()] = Elevation({\n            role: role,\n            elevatedAddress: elevatedAddress,\n            elevatedBy: _msgSender(),\n            expires: block.timestamp + duration\n        });\n    }\n\n    /// IMPLEMENTATION ///\n\n    function requestElevation(bytes32 role, address admin) public {\n        return requestElevation(role, admin, defaultElevationDuration());\n    }\n\n    // solhint-disable-next-line\n    function requestElevation(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address admin,\n        uint256 duration\n    ) public {\n        if (!hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, admin)) {\n            revert NotAdmin(admin);\n        }\n\n        // TODO: propose tx to multisig to call elevate with corresponding params\n    }\n\n    /// OVERRIDES ///\n\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role) internal view virtual override {\n        if (role == ADMIN_ROLE && !hasRole(ADMIN_ROLE, _msgSender())) {\n            // If the sender is elevated to admin, and the elevation is still valid, allow the call\n            if (_elevationKeys.contains(_msgSender())) {\n                Elevation memory elevation = _elevations[_msgSender()];\n                if (\n                    elevation.role == ADMIN_ROLE &&\n                    elevation.expires > block.timestamp\n                ) {\n                    return;\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        // In all other cases, delegate to the parent implementation\n        super._checkRole(role);\n    }\n\n    /// INTERNAL ///\n\n    modifier onlyFullAdmin() {\n        super._checkRole(ADMIN_ROLE);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    function housekeeping() public {\n        // Delete expired elevations\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < _elevationKeys.length(); i++) {\n            address key = _elevationKeys.at(i);\n            if (_elevations[key].expires < block.timestamp) {\n                _elevationKeys.remove(key);\n                delete _elevations[key];\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    function supportsInterface(\n        bytes4 interfaceId\n    )\n        public\n        view\n        virtual\n        override(ERC165Upgradeable, AccessControlUpgradeable)\n        returns (bool)\n    {\n        return\n            interfaceId == type(IAccessControlElevation).interfaceId ||\n            interfaceId == type(IHousekeeping).interfaceId ||\n            super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n    /// VIEWS ///\n\n    function defaultElevationDuration() public view returns (uint48) {\n        return\n            _elevationDuration == 0\n                ? DEFAULT_ELEVATION_DURATION\n                : _elevationDuration;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x223ab05f4afd9bdf88146f8299ca14ae5d73e374002c4b441cc02043a3124c2e","license":"MIT"},"contracts/libraries/access/Roles.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.9;\n\nabstract contract RoleUpgrader {\n    bytes32 public constant UPGRADER_ROLE = keccak256(\"UPGRADER_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RolePauser {\n    bytes32 public constant PAUSER_ROLE = keccak256(\"PAUSER_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleAdmin {\n    bytes32 public constant ADMIN_ROLE = keccak256(\"ADMIN_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleManager {\n    bytes32 public constant MANAGER_ROLE = keccak256(\"MANAGER_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleOperator {\n    bytes32 public constant OPERATOR_ROLE = keccak256(\"OPERATOR_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleProposer {\n    bytes32 public constant PROPOSER_ROLE = keccak256(\"PROPOSER_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleApprover {\n    bytes32 public constant APPROVER_ROLE = keccak256(\"APPROVER_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleValidator {\n    bytes32 public constant VALIDATOR_ROLE = keccak256(\"VALIDATOR_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleExecutor {\n    bytes32 public constant EXECUTOR_ROLE = keccak256(\"EXECUTOR_ROLE\");\n}\n\nabstract contract RoleCollectionDefault is RolePauser, RoleAdmin {}\nabstract contract RoleCollectionDefaultUpgradable is RoleUpgrader, RoleCollectionDefault {}\nabstract contract RoleCollectionDelegation is RoleManager, RoleOperator {}\nabstract contract RoleCollectionExecution is RoleProposer, RoleApprover, RoleValidator, RoleExecutor {}\n","keccak256":"0xb6c96f8b0da50fbdeed462fe3c2c2400639fe3fd275fa0555e2206b87b2168b0","license":"MIT"},"contracts/libraries/templates/ContractBase.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.9;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/security/PausableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/introspection/ERC165Upgradeable.sol\";\n\n\nimport \"../access/AccessControlElevation.sol\";\nimport \"../access/Roles.sol\";\n\nabstract contract AbstractContract {\n    ////// INTERNAL //////\n\n    /**\n     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new\n     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.\n     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps\n     */\n    uint256[50] private __gap;\n}\n\nabstract contract BaseContract is AbstractContract {\n    ////// INTERNAL //////\n\n    /**\n     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new\n     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.\n     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps\n     */\n    uint256[50] private __gap;\n}\n\nabstract contract ContractUpgradable is\n    AbstractContract,\n    Initializable,\n    ERC165Upgradeable,\n    UUPSUpgradeable,\n    PausableUpgradeable,\n    AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable,\n    AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable,\n    AccessControlElevation,\n    RoleCollectionDefaultUpgradable\n{\n    // CONST\n    uint48 private constant DEFAULT_ADMIN_DELAY = 3 * 24 * 60 * 60; // 3 days\n\n    /// INITIALIZATION ///\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializer for parent contracts. Should be called via super._initialize() in child contracts.\n     * \n     * IMPORTANT: The initializer has to be called to activate the contract. Nothing else works until initialization.\n     * IMPORTANT: Never call any initializer twice. Use new initializer functions for upgrades instead.\n     * \n     * To create additional initializer functions use the 'initializer' keyword.\n     * See: https://docs.openzeppelin.com/upgrades-plugins/1.x/writing-upgradeable#initializers\n     * \n     * @param admin Address of initial admin account (can and should be multi-sig)\n     */\n    function __BaseContract_init(address admin) internal virtual onlyInitializing {\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init();\n        __Pausable_init();\n        __AccessControl_init();\n        __AccessControlEnumerable_init();\n        __AccessControlDefaultAdminRules_init(DEFAULT_ADMIN_DELAY, admin);\n\n        _ensureRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, admin);\n        _ensureRole(PAUSER_ROLE, admin);\n        _ensureRole(UPGRADER_ROLE, admin);\n        _ensureRole(ADMIN_ROLE, admin);\n        _ensureRoleAdmin(ADMIN_ROLE, ADMIN_ROLE);\n    }\n\n    /// CONVENIENCE ///\n\n    function _ensureRole(bytes32 role, address account) internal {\n        if (!hasRole(role, account)) {\n            _grantRole(role, account);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function _ensureRoleAdmin(bytes32 role, bytes32 adminRole) internal {\n        if (getRoleAdmin(role) != adminRole) {\n            _setRoleAdmin(role, adminRole);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// OZ INTERFACE ///\n\n    function pause() public onlyRole(PAUSER_ROLE) {\n        _pause();\n    }\n\n    function unpause() public onlyRole(PAUSER_ROLE) {\n        _unpause();\n    }\n\n    /// OZ OVERRIDES ///\n    // The following functions are overrides required by Solidity.\n\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(\n        address newImplementation\n    ) internal virtual override onlyRole(UPGRADER_ROLE) {}\n\n    function _checkRole(bytes32 role) internal view virtual override(AccessControlUpgradeable, AccessControlElevation) {\n        super._checkRole(role);\n    }\n\n    function grantRole(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address account\n    )\n        public\n        virtual\n        override(\n            IAccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable\n        )\n    {\n        super.grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    function revokeRole(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address account\n    )\n        public\n        virtual\n        override(\n            IAccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable\n        )\n    {\n        super.revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    function renounceRole(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address account\n    )\n        public\n        virtual\n        override(\n            IAccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable\n        )\n    {\n        super.renounceRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    function _grantRole(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address account\n    )\n        internal\n        virtual\n        override(\n            AccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable\n        )\n    {\n        super._grantRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    function _revokeRole(\n        bytes32 role,\n        address account\n    )\n        internal\n        virtual\n        override(\n            AccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable\n        )\n    {\n        super._revokeRole(role, account);\n    }\n\n    function _setRoleAdmin(\n        bytes32 role,\n        bytes32 adminRole\n    )\n        internal\n        virtual\n        override(\n            AccessControlUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable\n        )\n    {\n        super._setRoleAdmin(role, adminRole);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\n     */\n    function supportsInterface(\n        bytes4 interfaceId\n    )\n        public\n        view\n        virtual\n        override(\n            ERC165Upgradeable,\n            AccessControlDefaultAdminRulesUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable,\n            AccessControlElevation\n        )\n        returns (bool)\n    {\n        return\n            super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n    }\n\n    ////// INTERNAL //////\n\n    /**\n     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new\n     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.\n     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps\n     */\n    uint256[50] private __gap;\n}\n\nabstract contract ContractUpgradableDelegatable is ContractUpgradable, RoleCollectionDelegation {\n    /// INITIALIZATION ///\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializer for parent contracts. Should be called via super._initialize() in child contracts.\n     * \n     * IMPORTANT: The initializer has to be called to activate the contract. Nothing else works until initialization.\n     * IMPORTANT: Never call any initializer twice. Use new initializer functions for upgrades instead.\n     * \n     * To create additional initializer functions use the 'initializer' keyword.\n     * See: https://docs.openzeppelin.com/upgrades-plugins/1.x/writing-upgradeable#initializers\n     * \n     * @param admin Address of initial admin account (can and should be multi-sig)\n     */\n    function __BaseContract_init(address admin) internal virtual override onlyInitializing {\n        super.__BaseContract_init(admin);\n        _ensureRoleAdmin(MANAGER_ROLE, ADMIN_ROLE);\n        _ensureRoleAdmin(OPERATOR_ROLE, MANAGER_ROLE);\n    }\n\n    ////// INTERNAL //////\n\n    /**\n     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new\n     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.\n     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps\n     */\n    uint256[50] private __gap;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x1637f89e957e1f92ed54f2c9940fddc3a680c6c2a3a02adab1afa62fb7ac183e","license":"MIT"},"contracts/libraries/utils/Housekeeping.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-2.0-or-later\npragma solidity ^0.8.0;\n\n/// @title Interface for Contracts that have regular housekeeping requirements\ninterface IHousekeeping {\n    function housekeeping() external;\n}\n\n","keccak256":"0x74bb59dbae1fa5298d80ada82fda4b4bbb8dfa8385fbf7f68dc1ef976a1ee8eb","license":"GPL-2.0-or-later"}},"version":1}

AdminChanged(address,address).details: Emitted when the admin account has changed.

BeaconUpgraded(address).details: Emitted when the beacon is changed.

DefaultAdminDelayChangeCanceled().details: Emitted when a {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} is reset if its schedule didn't pass.

DefaultAdminDelayChangeScheduled(uint48,.details: Emitted when a {defaultAdminDelay} change is started, setting `newDelay` as the next delay to be applied between default admin transfer after `effectSchedule` has passed.

DefaultAdminTransferCanceled().details: Emitted when a {pendingDefaultAdmin} is reset if it was never accepted, regardless of its schedule.

DefaultAdminTransferScheduled(address,ui.details: Emitted when a {defaultAdmin} transfer is started, setting `newAdmin` as the next address to become the {defaultAdmin} by calling {acceptDefaultAdminTransfer} only after `acceptSchedule` passes.

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this. _Available since v3.1._

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

acceptDefaultAdminTransfer().details: Completes a {defaultAdmin} transfer previously started with {beginDefaultAdminTransfer}. After calling the function: - `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` should be granted to the caller. - `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` should be revoked from the previous holder. - {pendingDefaultAdmin} should be reset to zero values. Requirements: - Only can be called by the {pendingDefaultAdmin}'s `newAdmin`. - The {pendingDefaultAdmin}'s `acceptSchedule` should've passed.

beginDefaultAdminTransfer(address).details: Starts a {defaultAdmin} transfer by setting a {pendingDefaultAdmin} scheduled for acceptance after the current timestamp plus a {defaultAdminDelay}. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. Emits a DefaultAdminRoleChangeStarted event.

cancelDefaultAdminTransfer().details: Cancels a {defaultAdmin} transfer previously started with {beginDefaultAdminTransfer}. A {pendingDefaultAdmin} not yet accepted can also be cancelled with this function. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. May emit a DefaultAdminTransferCanceled event.

changeDefaultAdminDelay(uint48).details: Initiates a {defaultAdminDelay} update by setting a {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} scheduled for getting into effect after the current timestamp plus a {defaultAdminDelay}. This function guarantees that any call to {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} done between the timestamp this method is called and the {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} effect schedule will use the current {defaultAdminDelay} set before calling. The {pendingDefaultAdminDelay}'s effect schedule is defined in a way that waiting until the schedule and then calling {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} with the new delay will take at least the same as another {defaultAdmin} complete transfer (including acceptance). The schedule is designed for two scenarios: - When the delay is changed for a larger one the schedule is `block.timestamp + newDelay` capped by {defaultAdminDelayIncreaseWait}. - When the delay is changed for a shorter one, the schedule is `block.timestamp + (current delay - new delay)`. A {pendingDefaultAdminDelay} that never got into effect will be canceled in favor of a new scheduled change. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. Emits a DefaultAdminDelayChangeScheduled event and may emit a DefaultAdminDelayChangeCanceled event.

defaultAdmin().details: Returns the address of the current `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` holder.

defaultAdminDelay().details: Returns the delay required to schedule the acceptance of a {defaultAdmin} transfer started. This delay will be added to the current timestamp when calling {beginDefaultAdminTransfer} to set the acceptance schedule. NOTE: If a delay change has been scheduled, it will take effect as soon as the schedule passes, making this function returns the new delay. See {changeDefaultAdminDelay}.

defaultAdminDelayIncreaseWait().details: Maximum time in seconds for an increase to {defaultAdminDelay} (that is scheduled using {changeDefaultAdminDelay}) to take effect. Default to 5 days. When the {defaultAdminDelay} is scheduled to be increased, it goes into effect after the new delay has passed with the purpose of giving enough time for reverting any accidental change (i.e. using milliseconds instead of seconds) that may lock the contract. However, to avoid excessive schedules, the wait is capped by this function and it can be overrode for a custom {defaultAdminDelay} increase scheduling. IMPORTANT: Make sure to add a reasonable amount of time while overriding this value, otherwise, there's a risk of setting a high new delay that goes into effect almost immediately without the possibility of human intervention in the case of an input error (eg. set milliseconds instead of seconds).

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

pendingDefaultAdmin().details: Returns a tuple of a `newAdmin` and an accept schedule. After the `schedule` passes, the `newAdmin` will be able to accept the {defaultAdmin} role by calling {acceptDefaultAdminTransfer}, completing the role transfer. A zero value only in `acceptSchedule` indicates no pending admin transfer. NOTE: A zero address `newAdmin` means that {defaultAdmin} is being renounced.

pendingDefaultAdminDelay().details: Returns a tuple of `newDelay` and an effect schedule. After the `schedule` passes, the `newDelay` will get into effect immediately for every new {defaultAdmin} transfer started with {beginDefaultAdminTransfer}. A zero value only in `effectSchedule` indicates no pending delay change. NOTE: A zero value only for `newDelay` means that the next {defaultAdminDelay} will be zero after the effect schedule.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

rollbackDefaultAdminDelay().details: Cancels a scheduled {defaultAdminDelay} change. Requirements: - Only can be called by the current {defaultAdmin}. May emit a DefaultAdminDelayChangeCanceled event.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.
